unnormalised: Local tailor, Ramesh Bhai, is seeing a huge rush before Diwali. Seems everyone wants new clothes! He's been working non-stop, especially on saree blouses. Apparently, the standard length for a blouse these days is around 14 inches, but many customers are asking for adjustments, some wanting it shorter by as much as 2 inches.
normalised: Local tailor, Ramesh Bhai, is seeing a huge rush before Diwali. Seems everyone wants new clothes! He's been working non-stop, especially on saree blouses. Apparently, the standard length for a blouse these days is around fourteen inches, but many customers are asking for adjustments, some wanting it shorter by as much as two inches.

unnormalised: Ramesh Bhai mentioned he’s used almost 50 meters of cotton lining this week alone. He also said he's had to buy extra thread - about 10 spools – because of the demand. He even joked about needing a new measuring tape, since his old one is starting to show its age after measuring countless kurtas and salwars.

unnormalised: The festive season is definitely keeping him busy. He's charging around Rs. 300 for a simple blouse stitching and Rs. 500 for more elaborate designs. "Bas, Bhagwan ki daya se sab theek chal raha hai," he said with a smile.
